metadata.title: Exposure to environmentally relevant concentrations of deltamethrin renders the Chinese rare minnow (Gobiocypris rarus) vulnerable to Pseudomonas fluorescens infection
metadata.abstract: In this study, to assess the immunotoxicity of deltamethrin on fish, adult Chinese rare minnows (Gobiocypris rarus) were exposed to 0.1, 0.3, and 1 μg/L deltamethrin for 28 d. Many immunological parameters and histopathological alterations were determined. The results showed that lymphocyte number was markedly decreased at 0.3 and 1 μg/L treatments, whereas the neutrophil number was strongly increased at 1 μg/L treatments (p p Pseudomonas fluorescens (P. fluorescens) for 48 h. At 24 and 48 h post-injection with P. fluorescens (hpi), the lymphocyte numbers were strongly reduced at 0.3 and 1 μg/L deltamethrin-exposed groups, whereas LYS and C3 levels were strongly reduced at 0.3 and 1 μg/L deltamethrin-exposed groups (p p P. fluorescens infection, subsequently inducing mortality.
metadata.author: Le Zhang, Xiangsheng Hong, Xu Zhao, Saihong Yan, Xufa Ma, Jinmiao Zha

introduction: In this study, to assess the immunotoxicity of deltamethrin on fish, adult Chinese rare minnows (Gobiocypris rarus) were exposed to 0.1, 0.3, and 1 μg/L deltamethrin for 28 d. Many immunological parameters and histopathological alterations were determined. The results showed that lymphocyte number was markedly decreased at 0.3 and 1 μg/L treatments, whereas the neutrophil number was strongly increased at 1 μg/L treatments (p p Pseudomonas fluorescens (P. fluorescens) for 48 h. At 24 and 48 h post-injection with P. fluorescens (hpi), the lymphocyte numbers were strongly reduced at 0.3 and 1 μg/L deltamethrin-exposed groups, whereas LYS and C3 levels were strongly reduced at 0.3 and 1 μg/L deltamethrin-exposed groups (p p P. fluorescens infection, subsequently inducing mortality.

summary: To assess the immunotoxicity of deltamethrin on fish, adult Chinese rare minnows (Gobiocypris rarus) were exposed to 0.1, 0.3, and 1 μg/L deltamethrin for 28 d.
Deltamethrin caused histopathological damage to liver, intestine, and gill of Chinese rare minnows.
Deltamethrin exposure destroyed fish immune system and induced fish immunosuppression.
Deltamethrin exposure rendered fish vulnerable to P.
Many immunological parameters and histopathological alterations were determined.

The results showed that lymphocyte number was markedly decreased at 0.3 and 1 μg/L treatments, whereas the neutrophil number was strongly increased at 1 μg/L treatments (p p Pseudomonas fluorescens (P.
At 24 and 48 h post-injection with P.

Fluorescens, the lymphocyte numbers were strongly reduced at 0.3 and 1 μg/L deltamethrin-exposed groups, whereas LYS and C3 levels were strongly reduced at 0.3 and 1 μg/L deltamethrin-exposed groups (p p P.

Introduction: To assess the immunotoxicity of deltamethrin on fish, adult Chinese rare minnows (Gobiocypris rarus) were exposed to 0.1, 0.3, and 1 μg/L deltamethrin for 28 d.
Deltamethrin caused histopathological damage to liver, intestine, and gill of Chinese rare minnows.
Deltamethrin exposure destroyed fish immune system and induced fish immunosuppression.
Results: Deltamethrin exposure rendered fish vulnerable to P.
Many immunological parameters and histopathological alterations were determined.

At 24 and 48 h post-injection with P.
